<!DOCTYPE DOCSENT SYSTEM './docsent.dtd'>
<DOCSENT DID='43'>
  <BODY>
    <HEADLINE>
      <S SNO='1' PAR='1' RSNT='1'>FOXNews.com</S>
    </HEADLINE>
    <TEXT>
      <S SNO='2' PAR='2' RSNT='1'>Thursday: Smoke billows from the Pirelli building after a small plane crashed into it.</S>
      <S SNO='3' PAR='3' RSNT='1'>MILAN, Italy   A small plane smashed into the tallest building in Milan Thursday evening, causing smoke to pour out of the heavily damaged top floors of the skyscraper.</S>
      <S SNO='4' PAR='4' RSNT='1'>Three people were reported killed and dozens of others were injured.</S>
      <S SNO='5' PAR='5' RSNT='1'>There were initial fears that the midtown crash was a terrorist attack   it was the second time since Sept. 11 that a plane has struck a high-rise building   but officials later said that it appeared to have been a tragic accident.</S>
      <S SNO='6' PAR='6' RSNT='1'>"It sounded like a bomb.</S>
      <S SNO='7' PAR='7' RSNT='1'>The pavement shook like an earthquake," said a woman identifying herself only as Lucia.</S>
      <S SNO='8' PAR='8' RSNT='1'>Some eyewitnesses reported that the plane was on fire before crashing into the 30-story Pirelli building, Milan Police Office Celerissimo De Simone said.</S>
      <S SNO='9' PAR='9' RSNT='1'>The Rockwell Commander plane, en route from Switzerland on a 20-minute flight to Milan, punched a hole in the 25th floor of the building, sparking a smoky fire that was quickly put out.</S>
      <S SNO='10' PAR='10' RSNT='1'>Rescuers helped bloodied men in business suits evacuate the building.</S>
      <S SNO='11' PAR='11' RSNT='1'>The weather was clear at the time of the crash, which occurred near the end of the work day and left gaping holes on both sides of the slim skyscraper.</S>
      <S SNO='12' PAR='12' RSNT='1'>A large section of an entire floor lost its walls, and smoke and liquid poured from the gash in one side of the building.</S>
      <S SNO='13' PAR='13' RSNT='1'>"The initial information that the Interior Ministry has leads us to lean toward an accident," Interior Minister Claudio Scajola said.</S>
      <S SNO='14' PAR='14' RSNT='1'>The pilot, identified as 75-year-old Luigi Sasulo of Pregassona, Switzerland, had sent out a distress call at 5:54 p.m. just before the crash near Milan's main train station, said De Simone.</S>
      <S SNO='15' PAR='15' RSNT='1'>RAI state TV reported that the pilot said he was experiencing engine trouble.</S>
      <S SNO='16' PAR='16' RSNT='1'>"We believe it isn't a terrorist attack," said police Sgt.</S>
      <S SNO='17' PAR='17' RSNT='1'>Vincenzo Curto, who was reached at the Carabinieri headquarters in Milan.</S>
      <S SNO='18' PAR='18' RSNT='1'>"The pilot might have taken ill or it was an engine problem."</S>
      <S SNO='19' PAR='19' RSNT='1'>In Rome, a spokesman for the senate president, Marcello Pera, said the interior minister had informed him that the crash didn't appear to be a terror attack.</S>
      <S SNO='20' PAR='20' RSNT='1'>Earlier, Pera had said it "very probably" was an attack.</S>
      <S SNO='21' PAR='21' RSNT='1'>The plane had taken off from Locarno, Switzerland, 50 miles northwest of Milan, and was heading to Milan's Linate airport.</S>
      <S SNO='22' PAR='22' RSNT='1'>Patrick Herr, spokesman for the Swiss air traffic control office SKYGUIDE, said the plane left Locarno at 5.15 p.m.</S>
      <S SNO='23' PAR='23' RSNT='1'>A woman who worked on the eighth floor, well below the crash, said she saw 10 people injured and bleeding.</S>
      <S SNO='24' PAR='24' RSNT='1'>News reports said at least 30 were taken to the hospital.</S>
      <S SNO='25' PAR='25' RSNT='1'>One Milan hospital, Fatebene Fratelli, said it had received 20 injured, including a woman with burns.</S>
      <S SNO='26' PAR='26' RSNT='1'>"It was shocking," said Luccheta Antonio, 52, a barber down the block.</S>
      <S SNO='27' PAR='27' RSNT='1'>"The windows shook, and the mirrors."</S>
      <S SNO='28' PAR='28' RSNT='1'>"It was a violent explosion," said Stefano Bottazzi, 35, who works in a skyscraper 500 yards from building.</S>
      <S SNO='29' PAR='29' RSNT='1'>"The clock fell to the floor."</S>
      <S SNO='30' PAR='30' RSNT='1'>On the streets, rescue workers in orange uniforms helped the injured.</S>
      <S SNO='31' PAR='31' RSNT='1'>Ambulances streamed into the area and pedestrians peered upward.</S>
      <S SNO='32' PAR='32' RSNT='1'>As ambulance crews worked, a man with his shirt splattered with blood and his hand covering a gash on his head was rushed from the scene.</S>
      <S SNO='33' PAR='33' RSNT='1'>Police cordoned off the area as passersby gawked at the skyscraper.</S>
      <S SNO='34' PAR='34' RSNT='1'>At 30 stories high, the Pirelli structure, located near the central train station, is Italy's first skyscraper and one of the world's tallest concrete buildings.</S>
      <S SNO='35' PAR='35' RSNT='1'>It was built in 1958 and designed by architects Gio Ponti and Pier Luigi Nervi.</S>
      <S SNO='36' PAR='36' RSNT='1'>The building is one of the main symbols of Milan, along with the city's cathedral.</S>
      <S SNO='37' PAR='37' RSNT='1'>The skyscraper, built of concrete and glass with a diamond-shaped floor plan, has inspired design around the world including the MetLife building in New York.</S>
      <S SNO='38' PAR='38' RSNT='1'>National Security Adviser Condoleezza Rice and White House chief of staff Andrew Card broke the news of the crash to President Bush, White House press secretary Ari Fleischer said.</S>
      <S SNO='39' PAR='39' RSNT='1'>"I think you can presume that we will be   if we are not already   in touch with Italian authorities and will ascertain precisely what the facts are," he said.</S>
      <S SNO='40' PAR='40' RSNT='1'>FBI personnel were assisting their Italian counterparts in the investigation, an FBI official said.</S>
      <S SNO='41' PAR='41' RSNT='1'>U.S. authorities had no intelligence suggesting any kind of terrorist attack was imminent in Milan, a U.S. official said.</S>
      <S SNO='42' PAR='42' RSNT='1'>On March 27, the State Department issued a warning for American citizens traveling in four Italian cities, including Milan, during Easter.</S>
      <S SNO='43' PAR='43' RSNT='1'>The warning said the possible threat was based on information about "extremist groups."</S>
      <S SNO='44' PAR='44' RSNT='1'>It was the second time since the Sept. 11 terror attacks that a plane has struck a high-rise building.</S>
      <S SNO='45' PAR='45' RSNT='1'>On Jan. 5, a 15-year-old boy flying alone crashed a stolen plane into a building in Tampa, Fla.</S>
      <S SNO='46' PAR='46' RSNT='1'>The boy, Charles Bishop, left behind a suicide note saying that Al Qaeda terrorists had tried to recruit him, but police said there was no truth to the claim.</S>
      <S SNO='47' PAR='47' RSNT='1'>Relatives of the boy, who was the only fatality, have filed a lawsuit claiming the acne drug Accutane was behind his suicide.</S>
      <S SNO='48' PAR='48' RSNT='1'>U.S. officials have called a mosque and cultural center in Milan "the main Al Qaeda station house in Europe."</S>
      <S SNO='49' PAR='49' RSNT='1'>Since Sept. 11, several individuals have been arrested in Milan as part of a crackdown on suspected Islamic militants.</S>
      <S SNO='50' PAR='50' RSNT='1'>Italian authorities uncovered an alleged Al Qaeda plot in January, 2001, to attack the U.S.</S>
      <S SNO='51' PAR='51' RSNT='1'>Embassy in Rome and are investigating whether a second plot was in the works earlier this year.</S>
      <S SNO='52' PAR='52' RSNT='1'>The Associated Press contributed to this report.</S>
      <S SNO='53' PAR='53' RSNT='1'>Privacy Statement.</S>

      <S SNO='61' PAR='61' RSNT='1'>U.S.</S>
      <S SNO='62' PAR='62' RSNT='1'>Regional Maps / Forecasts   U.S.</S>
